title: IT Help Desk Level I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Atrium Health
Interview Descriptions: Hands down the dumbest interviewing experience I’ve ever had. 2 women interviewed me at the same time. 1 of them was late so after explained my whole career background she says “ can you start over, I wasn’t here” so I waste 10 more minutes. Then they ask me 5 IT questions and literally tell me “ you can look up the answers if you want or if you want to double check your answers”. So I do exactly that. I get every question right. And then they say I didn’t get the job because I looked up answers. Then have the nerve to reach out a month later offering me the job as the 2nd choice.😂It was 15 an hour level 1 IT and I had a bachelors degree. Ended up getting a job for 30 an hour about 4 months later in cybersecurity. So I’m actually thankful that the interview process was so bad.
Interview Questions: If your browser is slow what is the first step you take?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Atrium Health

Interview Descriptions: Speak with the director and then interview with AD and athletic Staff. There’s different staff depending on the school or setting to work at. The interview is formal. Overall fair and they communicate very well.
Interview Questions: When has there been a difficult that you had to deal with it and how to did you handle it?

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC)
Interview Descriptions: The manager interviewed by phone the first time. The manager, clinical supervisor, and another administrator interviewed the second time onsite. The meeting included a floor tour and introduction to staff working that day.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in this clinical setting? Tell us your strengths and weaknesses. Tell us about a difficult past work relationship.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was great! They let me shadow and I had a wonderful time. Everybody I worked with was very friendly and the phone interview was very easy. I can't wait to work with them!
Interview Questions: What is one question you have for us?

title: Access/Outreach Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions:
It took some time for me to get a callback, I noticed the company would rather hire internally. Even though that is not a bad thing because once you are in the door the opportunities are limitless.

But nonetheless, once I received a call to come in for an in person interview, the supervisor was great and personable. The interview process was more like a conversation which I enjoyed.
Interview Questions:
Q: What made you choose this position?
Q: Describe a time when you had a difficult patient/customer

title: ICU RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Atrium Health
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by HR not the unit manager which I did not really like because they couldn't answer specific questions about the unit and I was told it was a "true ICU" which was a lie.  It is an ICU/IMC combined unit and the past few months I have had 3 patients instead of 2 more often than not.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience.

title: Senior Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: In the 1st hour, I was interviewed by four colleagues in a panel setting.   Directly after that, I was interviewed by an Assistant Vice President and a Director.   I was seated on one side of the table and they were seated across from me in the conference room.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: HCT I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was great! The questions they asked provided the team with information necessary to make a great choice in hiring, as well as provided them with the opportunity to get to know me. I was also given the opportunity to ask questions.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you were faced with a challenge and how you overcame that challenge.

title: Secretary III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed on two separate dates with three teams of 5-6 people. They tended to ask the same kinds of questions, which were all straight-forward and easy to answer. Was able to track my progress through the employment portal.
Interview Questions: If you have multiple deadlines, how would you prioritize your work?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Be ready to get interviewed! Questions are all about how you handle situations and challenges so have a few ready on your mind.  Dont sound like a robot, they want a real person, not a machine.  Be nice and smile!
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself ?

title: Patient Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Pineville, NC)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call (some questions asked over the phone) for an interview for the following week. The interview went well, I was very nervous. I was asked several personality and previous work experience questions, and also informed about the job and training. I received a call back with an offer after one week in a half with a job offer.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about yourself?
What 3 qualities will you bring to our company?

title: Lpn Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Atrium Health
Interview Descriptions: This experience was really calm, easy and comfortable. I am looking forward to working with such great doctors and staff. I couldn't be anymore excited. Atrium health would not be disappointed!
Interview Questions: Why would you want to work for this organization.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Process was lengthy, completed two phone screens and three in-person interviews. However, each interview setup was smooth and interviewers were accommodating to personal schedule.  Initial screening consists of interviewer from HR making contact to confirm your interest in the position followed by general questions surrounding what was submitted on the application (related to experience).  The follow-up, in-house interviews were more in-depth with a mix of questions related to experience, past successes and just a few situational-structured questions.
Interview Questions: What is your story? Why are you interested in this position?

title: Data Coor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Atrium Health
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview with each of the project leads, pretty general questions about workstyle, why are you interested in this role, background in science etcOne phone interview with each of the project leads, pretty general questions about workstyle, why are you interested in this role, background in science etc
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Research Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Atrium Health
Interview Descriptions: Fast, easy interview. Interviewers were very personable and friendly. Asked very easy questions about where I see myself in 5 years, my experience, and what I like about research.
Interview Questions: What do you like about research

title: Psychiatrist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Atrium Health in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Thorough, efficient process with a good overview of expectations. Had the opportunity to interview and meet several current MD's to allow for many different areas of input. Most MD's seem happy with their current role, though there is some degree of turnover as is the case in most hospital systems.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Atrium Health
Interview Descriptions: Very nice people. I spoke to the Office Manager first and then met with both of the staff members. They asked their questions, and I felt comfortable answering their questions. I hope I will be offered a role in this practice.
Interview Questions: What was a difficult situation and how did you handle it?

title: Systems Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I did not take the job but here was my experience back in early 2019.
I enjoyed the Interview and the team members were great. The dept. Mgrs were highly regarded, after meeting with them I can agree. Only downfall, their VMWare guy.He likes to be the smartest in the room but that just shows his weakness. VMWARE IS NOT A BIG DEAL DUDE.
Interview Questions: Typical System Engineer questions. Bring your A game.

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Normal Interview process. Applied to position found on Indeed and was contacted within a few days. Phone interview first and then went to office for in person meeting. Took about two weeks to hear back.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you had to overcome something

title: Rehab Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health
Interview Descriptions: You begin with a phone screen in which I spoke to my manager. Once I was invited to the facility, I had a 1:1 interview with the lead manager then proceeded to a group interview within the department.
Interview Questions: Recall one negative experience and how you dealt with it.

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interviewers contacted me via email to set up an interview time. The interviewer was professional. The interviewer asked a series of questions and took notes. I was given an opportunity to ask questions at the end.

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Don't be afraid to ask HR questions. They have a great team that wants to help you. By asking questions about their employment process, I went from a phone interview to being offered the job within a week.
Interview Questions: Questions about my familiarity with systems being used in research

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jan 2019

It was easy; managers were ok.

title: OTR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jan 2019

Interview Questions: Do you have any questions ?

title: Physical Therapist Interview

Interview Descriptions: Group interview format with multiples different disciplines present, all asking questions from a script. Pretty informal open to questions. Supervisor not present, only staff in the room. Whole process last maybe 30 minutes at most
Interview Questions: Can’t really remember questions asked

title: Senior Data Analyst Interview

They kept emphasizing how hard the job is, how much effort it takes, how short deadlines are, and how hard it is to get to know key contacts who can help you.

title: Patient Transporter Interview

A time where you had to make proper customer service decisions 
A time where you dealt with a problem and had to solve it 
How would your best friend describe you

title: Patient Service Specialist Interview

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Oct 2018

Phone interview with office manager, then had an interview with office manager, administrator, they read of a sheet. She showed me around the office.  Manager states she still has another  interview, if i am selected, i will be getting a call from HR.
still waiting to hear back.
Interview Questions:
were do you see yourself in 5 years?
tell me a difficult situation you were in?

title: Clinical Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Atrium Health

title: Medical Technologist Interview

Interview Descriptions: The interview was over the top considering it was just a Medical Technologist job. Panel, supervisor, then manager. Never had this intense of an interview for a medical technologist job.

title: Access/Outreach Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied to this position online and received an email a month later for a phone interview. The phone interview was was very brief lasted less than 5 minutes. During the phone interview I was asked what did I know about the position and if i had worked in the call center environment previously. At the end of the call I was invited for a in-person interview for that same week. The in-person interview I met with the manager that did my phone interview and a team supervisor. This interview lasted about  30 minutes.  Be sure to bring updated resumes as you should.  I interviewed on a Friday and received a offer on Monday!
Interview Questions:
If your co-workers or friends could describe you in 1 word what would it be? Whatever the 1 word is be sure to elaborate on why they would describe you with that word, try to avoid short answers. Use STAR Format!
Tell me a time when  you dealt with a angry customer?

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Received a call for a f2f interview was asked questions, explained in detail the position and the expectations of the role. Was also  given a tour of the office and met employees.
Interview Questions: How would you or have handled negative co workers?

title: Diagnostic Medical Sonographer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Atrium Health
Interview Descriptions: It was 11 years ago so many things have changed.  My interview was by the direct manager and included some of the doctors that I would actually be working with.  The last few techs have went through HR and have been asked redundant questions that do not even apply to the work they will do.  They also have had to go to multiple steps with different people (with none of those being the ones that actually have anything to do hands on with the office).  Corporate has definitely took over the interview process (and its beginning to show)
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Temp Interview

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview

title: Registered Nurse NICU Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Fast process once it’s started, once I applied I did not hear back so I called HR and they got in touch with hiring manager, the manager called me the same day.

title: Business Intelligence - Intermed Interview

Had a phone interview first with the manager of the group.  Then went in for an extensive interview with different managers/team members.  The entire process seemed a little "overkill" considering the job was Intermediate and did not pay that much.  It just seem to waste a lot of peoples time.
I should have not wasted my time considering what is going on in the new with Atrium.

1.  What are you looking for in a job?
2.  Why are you looking for a bob?
3.  What are your goals.
4.  A few other typical questions.

title: Registrar Interview

I didn't get hired, same job has been posted again and again and again since I applied.

Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very smooth, felt welcome by all. Paid for food and accommodation. Great staff. Would enjoy working with these people in the future. I don't know what else to say.
Interview Questions: About my projects

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Atrium Health
Interview Descriptions: Asked me could I be an intern while I was at an conference. Upon the first day there was a series of medical test that I had to participate in.
Interview Questions: What are you in school for?

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: All individuals were pleasant from managers to peers.  Often phone screen first, manager interview then peer interview was arranged, either in-person, FaceTime or phone.  It varied from position to position,
Interview Questions: Many related to the Core Values of the System

title: Data Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Smooth interview process. Met with an amazing team. The type of research was exciting. At the time, the physical environment was lacking, old building, dilapidated office furniture. Every person was friendly. You could sense a very positive atmosphere / culture.
Interview Questions: They asked about strengths and weaknesses. They described the position and their needs in great detail. Informative.

title: Field Service BMET Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: first phone interview, then single in person interview, then panel interview with hiring manager and some other colleagues. then there is typically a long waiting period before you hear something back but its just because it's a big corporation
Interview Questions: what separates me from another candidate

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Atrium Health
Interview Descriptions: Most units use peer interviews. Which means you have people with no experience or knowledge on interview techniques. So it really comes down to a popularity contest. And also means you usually end up working with terrible clinicians.
Interview Questions: They use behavioral type questions like "tell me about a time you had conflict with a coworker and how you handled it?"

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Atrium Health
Interview Descriptions:
I was sent an email from the hiring manager , requesting that I call her. I work 8-5pm in an office, so when we began to play phone tag, I tried emailing her. No response. I finally text her, and she let me know that they were at the "tail end" of the interview process. After how difficult it was to connect , I decided to wait until another opening . 

A month later another position was posted. I expressed interest,  and received an email from the manager. I called her to setup the interview, but was treated very poorly on the phone. She interrogated me as to why we didn't connect the first time,  and questioned my capabilities and interest. I held my tongue in that it was likely the archaic practice of not answering emails in 2017, and only accepting calls. This was a red flag for me, but decided to schedule the interview anyway, because it's a great organization.

When I arrived, the interview started off ok, then quickly took a turn for the worst much like our phone call. She asked that I give an example of project management skills, but no example would appease her. I asked her to explain her question, she smiled and shrugged her shoulders , and said she didn't know how. It was like shooting darts in the dark as to how to answer the question. By the end of the interview she told me they've already interviewed 16 other people , and had 3 more weeks of interviews. Overall, I left the interview with a bad impression and little to know information on what the position itself did. I like the company, but you don't treat candidates like that.
Interview Questions: What's your ideal culture

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed in a group setting for a position in the emergency department. Comfortable setting and process. I was interviewed by employees who would become my colleagues if I got the job which I really liked.
Interview Questions: Explain a time where you experienced conflict with a coworker and how you found a solution.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview with the nurse manager and several nurse supervisors. Everyone was friendly enough and the questions were fairly easy. If you've had CNA experience before, you should have no issue answering the questions.

title: Outreach Specialist Interview

Interview Descriptions: It was more like a personality interview. It was surprisingly one of the best ones I've been to! They go the exra mile to make sure they are hiring the right people.
Interview Questions: Describe why you choose to apply for this position

title: Xray Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Shelby, NC) in Apr 2017

title: Staff Chaplain Interview

Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Behavioral Health Clinician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone screening. I interviewed with people who would be my co-workers. I also interviewed with my director supervisor. I just needed to back up the skills I had listed on my resume.

title: ER STaff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Concord, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was about 30 mins long . was asked why I chose to seek a job at their facility. What frustrated me about ER...what I enjoyed about ER. Asked about my experience and background. Staff were friendly pleasant and welcoming.
Interview Questions: What attracted you to the ER?u

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC)
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was with 4 peer interviewers, and afterwards I had an interview with the manager and was shown around the department. 2 weeks later I got a call for a final interview with the director and was offered the job 4 days later.

title: Psychiatric Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Feb 2017

title: Research Technician Interview

Interview Questions: What type type of lab experience have you had?

title: Social Worker MSW Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I received a phone call requesting to schedule an interview approximately one week after I applied for the position. The woman calling was a supervisor in the Corporate Clinical Care Management department. She asked me to tell her a little about myself before inquiring when I might be able to come in for an interview. We agreed upon a date and time, but she said she was unable to confirm due to computer trouble. The woman said she would call me back the next day to confirm but never did. I called her a few days later, and the interview was officially scheduled.

The next week, I was interviewed by the woman with whom I spoke on the phone and her superior, the director of the department. The interview was very informal, and the women seemed enthusiastic and personable. However, they only asked me two questions. (Three, if you count "Do you have any questions for us?") They spent a lot of time discussing the position itself and what the job would involve, as opposed to asking about my experience and qualifications. Despite preparing for a more in-depth interview and tougher questions, I thought the interview went well. At the end of the interview, though, I was told they hoped to have a decision sent to HR by the next day. This information made me believe they already knew which candidate they wanted to hire, which is a possible explanation as to why they did not seem to care much about my interview.

Oh, and my interviewers answered a phone call (on speaker phone) in the middle of the interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Patient Service Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Monroe, NC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had two separate interviews the same day. The first was a peer interview asking general questions, describe myself, what will I do in difficult situations, and why did I leave my previous job. The second interview was with two supervisors asking the same questions. One supervisor told me to expect an email that contained a personality test. I received the email and completed the test. I never received a phone call or email with an offer.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a co-worker that does something you don't approve of.

title: Emergency Department RN Interview

title: VP Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Peer interview with questions from direct reports, as well as from peers.  Began with a phone i interview , and then advanced to Skype and eventually to an in person interview.  Final offer was made at end of on site interview

title: Outreach Specialist Interview

title: Radiology Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Shelby, NC) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was with the manager and educator of the department. The second was a peer interview with four of the staff nurses. Before interviewing I was given a tour of the department. I was offered the job within one business day. I want to address the physical ability test that is administered for staff nurses since it's components seem to be shrouded in mystery. The PAT includes 6 tasks: ROM (shoulders, neck, waist, toe touch), pushing a sled with 95 lbs for 50 ft down a hallway, pulling 45 lbs while standing in a staggered position, walk 500 ft at a comfortable pace, lift a 35 lb box from floor to waist height and place on a shelf, and perform a task with hips flexed at a 35 degree angle for 5 minutes ( I had to sort nuts and bolts.) Heart rate is measured after every task and should fall within normal range. Blood pressure is checked at the beginning of the exam and should not be above 160/100.
Interview Questions:
If 3 of the people closest to you were sitting here; who are they and what would they say about you?
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
How do you ensure that you present yourself as a professional on the job?

Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took about an hour.  It was informal and thorough. The process gave both the candidate and interviewer a chance to learn about  each other and the company as a whole.  The process also gave me (the candidate) a chance to get a feel for management as a whole.  The staff really cares about its employees and set out to hire the best candidates.
Interview Questions: What make you a good fit for our company.

title: Clerical Postion Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is long. I've only been to the first part, which was with the manager. She was very nice and very professional. I recently got called for the second part which is the peer interview. I've never had a peer interview before and I have to admit I'm nervous because I don't know what to expect. Hopefully everything goes well and I get the position!
Interview Questions: Why would you be a good asset to the team?

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Rock Hill, SC) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Consisted of two managers, asking the questions as "describe a time when".... I don't interview well, However I have been in the hospital registration field for over 6 years.  I could tell from of the managers that I was already declined for the job from all the excuses she was making about the long hiring process.  I'm sure they hired someone who interviewed well, but has no work experience in that field.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received a phone call a week later from the hiring manager inviting me to attend for an interview the next week. Very detailed but semi formal interview with two managers immediately followed by a peer interview with two staff members. Very cordial and welcoming team. positive experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when a colleague made a mistake.

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Atrium Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview process very detailed and thorough and with a collaborative interviewing team. The team has each member ask a question that is chosen by the individual. There is ample time to share background with the team
Interview Questions: What was your past hospital experience

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health
Interview Descriptions:
Most of the questions were standard behavioral and teamwork related. The interview panel was not engaged, only one person seems to be knowledgeable on the position requirements and expectations.

It was for them like following a check list to mark all the boxes for the hiring process and get it over with.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Healthcare Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Meet with unit managers and interview with them.  After that you will interview with a peer interview committee (size depends on who is available from the team that day)
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself five years from now?

title: Senior Marketing Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Atrium Health
Interview Descriptions: very cumbersome, many rounds of interviews, long lead times between interviews, no static group of interviewers, some entry level employees conducting interviews, senior leadership was no prepared to talk about job description
Interview Questions: diversity related

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call about a week after applying for the position asking me to come in for an initial interview the following week. During the interview, the interviewer asked me several of the typical questions, described the position details and office environment, then showed me around and introduced me to everyone we walked past. About a week later, the same interviewer emailed me asking if I could return for follow up interviews with the physicians the position assists. I completed four more interviews over three hours, and each interview went very well. Everyone I met during the interview process was incredibly professional and friendly, and I truly enjoyed the interview process. Unfortunately, I was selected for the job, but HR revoked approval to fill the position before I was officially hired.
Interview Questions: One interviewer said her favorite question was to ask me if there was a question that I wish she had asked me.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: My resume was pulled by an HR specialist from Indeed.com.  I never met the HR person through the entire interview process.  I was interviewed by a Manager in the department I was being considered for, interviewed with the executives with whom I was to support, and still never officially met anyone from HR with regard to my specific job.   When I turned in my notice, I was never contact by HR for an exit interview.  What does HR do at this company?
Interview Questions: Do you like working in a team environment or independently?

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very long process that lasted around 3 months total. Began with a brief phone call requesting an interview. Completed one in-person interview that was one on one with the department head. Completed a second interview with a group of doctors and met most of the people who work within the department.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation and how you handled it.

title: PT/OT Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: applied online. had a phone interview a couple weeks later with someone from HR. Made it to the next step and had a phone interview with the hiring manager. Then had in person panel interview with a couple therapists and the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: How did you handle an irate customer?

title: Registrar/PRN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: was called in to interview - panel of three. I was asked only three questions. The typical behavior questions. I was unsure of how to answer the questions they were asking. My throat became irritated making it hard for me to speak. I politely asked if I could take a sip of my bottled water. They seem to be irritated by that.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Its a panel interview and the questions are the regular behavioral interview questions, tell about the time you made a mistake? How did you deal with a irate customer? Tell us about yourself?
Interview Questions: Do you have any questions for us is the last questions they ask

title: Nurse Assistant/Healthcare Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Atrium Health in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was very long. The department does their own hiring process, and then the Human Resources department does a separate hiring process. There were background checks, tests, and certifications required for this position so that also extended the new hire process.
Interview Questions: what makes you capable of taking on this position.

title: Management Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Atrium Health
Interview Descriptions: I was recruited from outside the region.  I learned later that this was the case with many hires, who are lured by the size of the organization.  The interview process was lengthy and disorganized.  The HR recruiter was overloaded to the point of making me feel like an appointment rather than a person.
Interview Questions: Have you found a church, yet?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Atrium Health
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted by the recruiter who scheduled the interview and met with me on the day of my interview. I met with my future supervisor and director on the first interview. On the second interview I had a peer-interview with my future co-workers and then met with upper management.
Interview Questions: I was asked to describe a situation when I knew I had done something wrong.

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone interview and then once you pass that step the second step was an in person interview.  The in person interview was much easier than the phone.  The in person interview was a panel.  The entire team interviewed you.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.  

Why CHS?

title: Assistant Vice President Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview and office interview.  They did not focus on whether I could do the job and drive the department success.  They focused on whether I could manage a bunch of unhappy people and make them happy.  

They ended up hiring someone internally that had turned around unhappy people in another department.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position.

title: Contractor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was a vetting process through an employment agency in which you were chosen to proceed on to the next level,  once you passed  employment agency vetting  process you were to do an  interview demonstrating technical skills needed for the position.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a user that has a technical question in which you did not know the answer?

title: Patient Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Pineville, NC) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: First you will get a call from HR wanting to set up a phone interview. They will give you a very generic standard interview which I'm sure you've heard before. Then you will be asked to come in and interview with the director and/or supervisor in person. This is more of an opportunity for you to make a good impression and talk about your work experience. Mine was very informal and approachable.
Interview Questions: Think of a challenge that you faced with co-workers when working at a previous job. How did you overcome it?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health
Interview Descriptions: It was a great process
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Vice President Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health
Interview Descriptions: The apply process is lengthly and they do not support resume parsing which requires you to type in your last 10 years of experience.
Interview Questions: Salary expectations

title: Clinical Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Atrium Health in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview for some positions, and peer/panel interviews are very important they want the staff to feel that their opinion counts in hiring process as well. There are several levels to the interviewing process, the management team, then the staff.
Interview Questions: Rank the following in the order of importance to you: job security, income, recognition, challenge.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Be aware the smaller the unit/department, the more lengthy, thorough and comprehensive  the interview process. Small teams require a certain amount of cohesiveness. Hiring managers will be looking for team members who can fit in and work seemlessly with their existing staff.
Interview Questions: Are you a leader or a follower?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Atrium Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied while still in nursing school (senior year, second semester). I went to their career website and they specifically had a section for new grads. I submitted my application and posted a resume. I don't remember the amount of time between submission and my first phone call, but it was an HR recruiter who interviewed me via telephone. She told me about the different areas that had job openings, we discussed the typical interview questions and we narrowed down the job opening lists to three options for in person interviews. We set up a date that worked for me (I would be coming from out of state) to have all 3 interviews. I went to 2 of the 3 because one of them ended up being filled prior to me coming. Both interviews were initially with the floor managers. Because they knew I was not from the area they went ahead and called people from the floor to do a peer interview with me. One floor I knew I would not like there and a peer interview did not happen with them. I had barely got out to the parking deck and the HR recruiter was calling me saying the manager on the one floor that I did like and had a peer interview with wanted to extend me a full-time position! I was thinking that's great or they're very disparate! Turns out it was a little of both (well disparate is a bit too strong) but I have enjoyed working there and it's been a great fit!
Interview Questions: It wasn't unexpected, but I hate answering questions like this: Tell me a time when you were in a difficult situation and you had to break policy?

title: Managed Care Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Put in through our Referral Portal, Team called but this was a PRN position that was not mentioned in the job description. I was a good fit but was looking for a full time position
Interview Questions: Are you a team player

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Atrium Health
Interview Descriptions: Great Experience
Interview Questions: None of the questions were difficult

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got a call from HR and later from hiring manager. The process moved along very quickly and they flew me in for an onsight interview the next week. The interview went quite well I thought, but I never got any response back from. After a couple of email, I gave up on the process.
Interview Questions: Standard Personality questions

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Atrium Health in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Selected ambiguous questions randomly from a sheet of paper...group peer interview chose these questions and rated on scale 1-5. Overall score was then presented to hiring manager but typically managers override any perceptions gathered by peers.
Interview Questions: Name a time when..., how did you handle a specific situation

title: Medical Surgical RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: HR very difficult to get a hold of, process takes months to just get a call back from HR. once they did get back to me they were very rude when I asked them to reconsider my salary considering I have experience to which they responded it was a sensitive topic to discuss my pay.
Interview Questions: why did you become a nurse

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Team interview, where each team member presented questions. The questions were typical interview questions. They also took the describe the dynamics of the unit. Also, received a tour of facility.
Interview Questions: Tell about a time when you had a conflict with a teammate and how it was handled.

title: Rad Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, called for interview within about 5 days.  Met the interviewer at a different location set up to handle all the interviews.  Several people lined up for interviews for a new facility.
Interview Questions: Was there a time that you did not agree with a coworker and what did you do to resolve the situation?

title: Financial Services Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC)
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was a phone interview with the HR rep.  The difficulty level of the questions I would say was commensurate with the position.  As best as I could ascertain, there was a fair mix of knowledge-based questions as well as technical questions.  The second interview was with the actual hiring manager and again there seemed to be a fair mix and balance of questions.  The manager seemed to do well in discussing the position and what he was looking for in a candidate.
Interview Questions: How do you think our area could benefit as a result of you becoming a member of our team?

title: Applications Specialist - Senior Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submit resume online, call back for interview with a small group. General questions seeking to gauge skillset for technology as well as soft skills in dealing with people. No truly difficult questions. Essentially, team wants to know that you can handle scripting, fast paced changes, self direction, and deal with users that may not be technologically savy. A few questions leading towards dealing with vendors, self-led problem solving, and experience in past tech roles are present.
Interview Questions: No truly difficult questions

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Process was probably the best part of the whole experience. All smiles by interviewer. Was interviewed by 3 people that I initially ended up working with. I interviewed 1:1 with a management person and then two people that were not management or leadership.
Interview Questions: Experience, Skill Set.

title: Outreach Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with HR, then one on one with a department manager on site. They tell you about the department and the different teams and what they do. Then she asked which one I thought would be a good fit. But then they just pick one for. I didn't find out where I would be working until my 1st day of training.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Nurse Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: The Hiring process was moderate and efficient. Very easy to understand of the questions to answer. The Managers and staff were friendly and very professional throughout this process. I had personal interview with the supervisor and after a peer interview with the staff to see if I would make a great fit for the position.
Interview Questions: what can you bring to the company?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very professional and quick. When I arrived her assistant walked me into my interview room and make the experience very comfortable. The hiring manager was very professional and nice. She took her time giving an overview of the company and the position in which I had applied. Overall, it was a great experience
Interview Questions: Give me an example of a time you had to deal with a difficult person. How did you handle the encounter

title: Technical Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty straight forward with very basic troubleshooting questions. General questions about helping a user with office products or navigating through an application. You really just need to know basic tasks like how to reset Internet Explorer. Also how to reset passwords in Active Directory. The role its self is extremely easy if your the type of person that helps family/friends on how to use their computers.
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult customers.

title: NA I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: The whole process took about a month.  I applied online, and was called to interview two weeks later. The interviewers were very kind and professional. I interviewed with two managers, and had one peer interview. They asked mainly behavioral questions.  The interview process took an hour.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you were asked to do something against work policy, and how did you handle it?

title: Patient Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Concord, NC) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: It is very difficult to get an interview in the system unless you know somebody. HR is very slow to get back with people. I was lucky and my manager really needed to fill the position so I was able to deal with her directly and the process went very quickly. It is extremely hard to move around in the company.
Interview Questions: What is one thing you can improve about yourself?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Direct care for Injury Patients, responsible for daily care and assisted daily living, transporting, and dressing patients. Lifting and dressing wounds were also other responsible. Phone Interview was used to screen applicants, after which Called in to to a personal interview and took a tour of the Levine cancer Institute facility.
Interview Questions: How would I pay for my living expenses since it was just a part time position.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was difficult don't have much to say about it just wanted to do my best and be the best I can be. I will continue to do my best and be my best.
Interview Questions: THey asked lots of different questions.

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online then conducted a telephone interview which lead to the scheduling of a 
face to face interview.
Interview Questions: Why are you no longer in your previous position

title: Applications Specialist - Senior Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: First there was a phone screen then an in-person interview.  In total I met with three employees for a half day session.  All of the questions were straight forward and dealt with my experience, what I was looking for a position, and what motivates me.  They spent a portion of the time describing the position and expectations.
Interview Questions: What type of environment do I enjoying working in?

title: Care Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Atrium Health in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: was very calm and not so nervous because the nurse & clinical manager interviewing me was nice sweet an understanding it could be nervous at a interview. i was so nervous but when we started i calmed down a lot. that was the most easy going interview i have been in ever. before the interview i got to explore what the care partners did and a typical day as a care partner.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself?what is a weakness? what is a strength?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 12 months. I interviewed at Atrium Health in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: nice and easy. staff made it very comfortable. a lot of qhestion and answering fit test for a mask, and drug testing. orientation for two to three days, and training on job site
Interview Questions: what can you contribute to our company

title: Live Answer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: All applications are to be completed online. When called for an interview, you will meet with the office manager, and the office coordinator. The second interview is called a peer interview. You will be interviewed by people that work in the office. if you are the chosen candidate than you will be informed by HR. You will be given your start date.They schedule you for a health assessment that will include a urine drug screening that will immediately give results. once this is approved you will have about 1 week of paid orientation. The length  depends on what you do. Next, you will go to your work location that's when the real training begins.
Interview Questions: Most difficult was communication about getting your identity set up on a computer. personalizing your work space. This may change depending on your job, or work location.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Pineville, NC) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied online at carolinashealthcare.org under careers. You can save all the jobs you like if you make a profile. The hiring process took about 3 months. I was moving from Texas yet there was no assistance with flights for interviewing. I interviewed first with a person from HR twice. She was very cordial and professional. My final interview was with the department nurse manager. She was wonderful and did not ask to many hard questions.
Interview Questions: Three negative qualities about yourself.

title: Clerical Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Had someone inside ,went to posted openings ,sent resume ,was reviewed and called
Interview Questions: Explain what you feel you do really well

title: Temporary Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: Very long and drawn out process. If you need a job right away do not go here. After being interviewed I had to go back for a skills assessment and then had to wait several days to hear how I did on that. I was then scheduled for a health assessment and drug screen. I had to take my immunization record, and have booster shots and a TB skin test. The drug test was one of the immediate pee stick ones. They checked for marijuana, cocaine, and opiates. There was an orientation the next week, and I started working immediately. The company makes you feel insignificant, and unneeded.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a tough situation with a customer/patient at your previous job?

title: Nursing Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: I had a peer interview. This was something very new for me but I really enjoyed it. The staff chosen to interview me made me feel comfortable in talking with them.
Interview Questions: What is one of your weaknesses?

title: Systems Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of a preliminary phone interview, a tour of the facilities and 30-45 minutes of questions from the team. The questions asked were fairly typical. I got the impression that teams operated in a rigid siloed structure, which is normal for an organization this size. Overall there was nothing that really stood out, positive or negative.
Interview Questions: None of the questions were especially difficult. It was unexpected when they asked if I would be able to develop .Net applications for the platform.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Easy process, it can take about 30 days or so, they are big on checking all reference . Also they will interview with the nurse manager and you will have a peer interview as well.
Interview Questions: They ask for many examples when you used the nursing process and what the outcomes were.

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: It was all really easy. People were very nice. I was really glad I went and they provided a very laidback environment to interview in. The questions were all quite expected and normal - no curve balls. Also included informational interview things, where they told me a lot about the company and the position.
Interview Questions: sell me this pen

title: Technical Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was called for a phone screen by the manager and after that I was brought in interview with her and 3 of her colleagues. There were four 30 minute interview sessions and the questions they asked seemed to overlap.  Just basic technical questions and nothing too difficult to answer.   My only problem is the feedback with the company after the interview has completed.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for the hospital?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through their website. Next a recruiter calls for a phone interview. Finally, there is a group interview in person with the current staff.  The recruiter calls you with the offer or emails you a form letter denial. I was offered a position as soon as I arrived home from the group interview.
Interview Questions: "Tell us about a time you disagreed with a supervisor."

title: Quality Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: First, it is difficult to even get an interview with the company. If you do, you will interview with the hiring manager & some people you would be working with. Then an interview with HR. HR will then have you do a drug test and obtain a background check.
Interview Questions: Getting an interview. What are your career aspirations? How would you handle various situations?

title: PRN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Atrium Health (New Bern, NC) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions:
put in application. waited for several days for a call. had to go to HR in person to get an appointment.
interviewed with one person. had to go back a second time. offered the job. salary not good. declined
Interview Questions: how would you handle disagreement with co-worker?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: You interview initially with the manager of the unit. It is then followed by a peer interview. The questions that they ask are similar.  The guestions are mostly scenario questions. They want examples of when you dealt with a difficult patient. They will ask why you want to work for their organization. The manager was very nice and the hr department is very helpful. Even though I didn't accept the offer. They continued to look for other positions with a more suitable schedule.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you were asked to do something that was against hospital policy.

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: Consisted of a HR screening call to ensure I could conjugate nouns & verbs, a disorganized one-on-one with a director,  a peer interview from a group that were not actually peers and a AVP.    Seemed there was a definite lack of communication and coordination between the hiring managers and HR.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation when....

title: Applications Specialist - Senior Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: Carolinas is great in that they will have multiple people interview you to assess fit for a variety of openings.  Be prepared that you might not be interviewed for just one opening.  At first, I was confused as to why I was interviewing with Directors from other divisions.  Now that I'm in the job, I understand more.  Even at staff level, interviews included peers, supervisors, and executive leadership (AVP).  It gave me the impression that the executives are engaged in the process and people.  The folks I interviewed with were very bright and articulate which made me all the more enthusiastic about accepting the offer.  Everyone I've seen interview here has had at least a full day onsite of interviews.  That is only after phone interviews with HR and then with supervising manager.
Interview Questions: Why are you no longer employed with....?

title: Systems Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Atrium Health (Charlotte, NC) in Feb 2008
Interview Descriptions: I was forwarded to the company via a staffing agency. I interviewed with HR on the phone (general career questions and resume checking) and with a peer 1:1 in person. Moderate level technical questions. Followed by a 1:1 leadership interview in person. Background and situational interview, moderately difficult. Was contacted by the staffing agency within a week that the company had selected me. Completed a drug test and background investigation before starting work. Worked as a contractor through the staffing agency for one year before being brought on board full time - but the usual wait time is 90 to 120 days.
Interview Questions: Describe a time in your career when you were faced with an ethical delimma and how you dealth with it.
